name: 26 The Crescent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed with Michael and Joyce several times and consider them our first choice when we are in the area.
reviews.title: We keep going back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are always made very welcome and they get top marks for every aspect of their accommodation.
reviews.title: You get what is says on the tin...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: We stayed at no. 26 The Crescent at the beginning of june 2012 which was during the queen's Diamond Jubilee weekend. Michael and Joyce's hospitality was second to none and we had some really good laughs with them throughout our stay. We had our elderly aunt with us and they were so friendly and extra attentive towards her. a beautiful house with each bedroom decorated an furnished to a high quality.
reviews.title: A major WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The choice and and quality of the breakfast was treat and the wee (complimentary) dram in the evening was a lovely extra treat.
reviews.title: Before we return next week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous place. Fabulou service. Fabulous food. Would stay again without thinking twice.
reviews.title: My stay at No. 26 the crescent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for one night in August 2012. Lovely hosts. We were even given an ice bucket full of ice (unheard of in Britain) and lovely glasses for our drinks. Beautiful breakfast. Only tiny complaint was no shower. We haven't had a bath in 40 years but managed to survive. Thoroughly recommend this B & B.
reviews.title: Fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here in July prior to attending a wedding at Culzean Casltle we had a very comfortable room the only draw back was the on suite was quite small which was fine for me but my partner found it to small but he is a tall guy. Having said that we had a lovely welcome and they kindly gave us a champagne breakfast to celebrate the forth comming wedding with a really hearty breakfast. Really friendly hosts well done Joyce and Micheal.
reviews.title: The best porridge yummm!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived earlier than we said (Joyce was so pleasant and welcoming). This was a true B&B with so much to offer. You can tell both Joyce and Michael love what they do in the personal touches of the B&B. We stayed 10 days in Scotland and Ireland (9 different B&B's) and my husband and I agreed this was our favorite. Even though it was our first stop on our journey, we still remember it. The rooms were large, very cozily decorated, and the breakfast was oh so good. It's also such a great value (money-wise). We absolutely loved our stay and it's because of this we want to go back to Ayr. Both Joyce and Michael had so many good recommendations for us and we wanted to stay longer. The breakfast was so yummy and I'm surprised they are #2 on tripadvisor. They definitely deserve #1!!!!
reviews.title: Should be #1 B&B in Ayr (or in all of Scotland)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed for one night at the beginning of august in this very comfortable B&B
reviews.title: Linda L

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: the rooms are all outstanding that you are spoiled for choice
reviews.title: Amazing breakfasts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sadly we were only there one night and we should have spent a couple of nights here. Michael and Joyce are fantastic hosts. Both are extremely hospitable and most willing to help you with any needs. For our 17-day trip to Scotland we stayed at 11 different B&B's and the bedroom we stayed in (facing the front) was probably THE most romantic. Fantastic canopy bed. When we walked in the room there was just a wonderful fragrance that set the mood! The room was a very good size and as a bonus we had a pant presser in the room.
reviews.title: One of THE Best B&B's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast was wonderful and the breakfast room was very charming. Michael gave us an excellent recommendation (and made the reservations) on a wondeful restaurant - Beresford.
reviews.title: Five Stars and More

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If there's a better B&B anywhere, I've yet to find it. My hosts, Michael and Joyce, made my two night stay with them one of the highlights of a three week vacation to the UK. The breakfast was superb, the room spotless and comfortable, and the hospitality unmatched. In short, No. 26 The Crescent is everything a five star accomodation should be - and then some. I'm already anticipating my next stay there.
reviews.title: Memorable for all the right reasons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend staying here, the owners Michael and Joyce make sure you feel very welcome and everything you need is taken care of. The accommodation is very good, the room was clean and tidy and most importantly the breakfast was spot on. I had porridge and a full Scottish breakfast both of which i thoroughly enjoyed. 10/10 definitely stay here again and look forward to doing so, Michael was a good laugh!
reviews.title: Wonderful welcome and visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came up home for a wedding and were looking for something different for the weekend and boy did we find it. What a lovely experience from being warmly greeted by Michael at the door, the lovely warm room with such a nice fragrance. The help with the bags whilst the added extra of the parking pass.
reviews.title: 'A Gem'

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A touch of class. Room very clean, well presented and comfortable in a beautifully decorated house within walking distance to the town centre and seafront. Breakfast was delicious. Michael and Joyce very helpful and friendly hosts. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what to tell you about 26 the crescent my husband and i arrived on friday the 10 august to the most wonderfully welcome from micheal and joyce and the welcome continued for are hold stay they are two of the most friend people i have ever met we left ayr with new friends. now about the rooms the are so clean and well decorated and so well kept and the food was out of this world i have eaten in some top hotels who didnt give you the service are the quality the we got from micheal and joyce .and i want to finish by saying a great big thank you for makeing are wee weekend break brilliant we will be back .
reviews.title: weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommended. This was the best B&B that we stayed in on our 1 week trip in Scotland. First class decorating, bedding and amenities, cleanliness. Owners were extremely helpful and friendly, as others have mentioned. They really make you feel at home.
reviews.title: Classy B&B in classy area of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The neighbourhood is very upper end and only a 5-10 minute walk from the beachfront or into town to eat. Perfect location. £75 per night for 2.
reviews.title: Visited again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just simply the best, stayed at 26 before and nothing has changed, don't bother searching, just book, that's if you can get in, you won't be disappointed. Michael and Joyce are the perfect hosts; they are so knowledgeable about the local restaurants and area.
reviews.title: We give this a 6 star rating

description: 5 star bed and breakfast situated in the town of Ayr. First class Scottish Hospitality. All rooms en-suite. Traditional breakfast included.
